BugInstance.BugMessage: Method malcolm.ComplexClass.main(String[]) prints the stack trace to the console
BugInstance.ResolutionSuggestion: This method prints a stack trace to the console. This is non configurable, and causes an application to look unprofessional. Switch to using loggers so that users can control what is logged and where.

BugInstance.BugMessage: Useless object stored in variable list of method malcolm.ComplexClass.main(String[])
BugInstance.ResolutionSuggestion:
Our analysis shows that this object is useless. It's created and modified, but its value never go outside of the method or produce any side-effect. Either there is a mistake and object was intended to be used or it can be removed.

This analysis rarely produces false-positives. Common false-positive cases include:

- This object used to implicitly throw some obscure exception.

- This object used as a stub to generalize the code.

- This object used to hold strong references to weak/soft-referenced objects.

BugInstance.BugMessage: Method malcolm.ComplexClass.main(String[]) creates and initializes a collection but never reads or gains information from it
BugInstance.ResolutionSuggestion: This method creates and initializes a collection but then never access this collection to gain information, or fetch items from the collection. It is likely that this collection is left over from a past effort, and can be removed.
